newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan investors may buy more foreign bonds - report.
newsitem.headline: Japan investors may buy more foreign bonds - report.

text.p: Japanese institutional investors are expected to boost their foreign bond investments, seeking higher returns as interest rates remain at record low levels at home, Sumitomo Life Research Institute said on Friday.
It said that investors such as life insurance companies are expected to beef up foreign bond investments amid increasing competition to get a bigger slice of the business of pension fund bodies.
This could help forestall a possible yen rise and contribute to the stability of the dollar/yen exchange rate, it added.
